meanings.definition: The act, practice, or art of mimicking someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her mimicries of famous actors always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The children's mimicries of animals were quite impressive.
meanings.sent3: During the play, his mimicries of the teacher were so accurate that even the principal chuckled.
meanings.sent4: The mimicries of nature by the artist were so lifelike, they seemed to come alive.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's mimicries of politicians were so spot-on, the audience couldn't stop applauding.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being a mimic.
meanings.sent1: The perfection of her mimicries amazed everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: His mimicries of different accents were so convincing.
meanings.sent3: The mimicries of the parrot made the whole family burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The mimicries of the robot were so precise, it was hard to tell it apart from a real person.
meanings.sent5: The mimicries of the actor were so natural, it felt like watching the real person.

meanings.definition: An instance of mimicking or imitating someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The mimicries of the students during the talent show were hilarious.
meanings.sent2: Her mimicries of famous singers were always a hit at parties.
meanings.sent3: The mimicries of the baby trying to talk like the adults were adorable.
meanings.sent4: His mimicries of the boss's mannerisms were so accurate, it was uncanny.
meanings.sent5: The mimicries of the comedian had the audience in stitches.
